title: Ensure tab completion works with installed brew package
description: Verify and ensure that shell tab completion works correctly when dogcat is installed via Homebrew (brew). This includes testing that completions are properly registered and functional for the dcat CLI.

title: Add worktree field to Issue data model
description: Add an optional worktree field to the Issue dataclass in models.py to track which git worktree an issue belongs to. This would allow assigning and filtering issues by worktree when multiple worktrees share the same .dogcats directory.

title: Add dependency graph visualization command
description: Add a `dcat graph` command that renders an ASCII visualization of the dependency DAG for a given issue or the entire tracker. Should show blocks/parent-child relationships as a box-drawing or compact tree diagram. Useful for understanding bottlenecks and planning order of work.
acceptance:
- `dcat graph <issue_id>` shows the subgraph reachable from that issue
- `dcat graph` (no args) shows the full dependency graph
- Blocked edges visually distinct from parent-child edges
- Works in agent-only mode (--agent-only)

title: Set up dcat web command with FastAPI + Jinja2 + Tailwind skeleton
description: Create the dcat web subcommand (feature-gated behind DCAT_FEATURE_WEB). Set up FastAPI app with Jinja2 templating and Tailwind CSS via CDN. Bind to 127.0.0.1:8000 by default. Add FastAPI and Jinja2 as optional dependencies. Create base template with Tailwind CDN link, navigation layout, and project name header.
acceptance:
- dcat web starts a FastAPI server on 127.0.0.1:8000
- Feature-gated: requires DCAT_FEATURE_WEB=1
- Base HTML template with Tailwind CDN and nav layout
- / redirects to /issues
- --port and --host flags supported
notes: Mobile-first responsive design. Use Tailwind responsive utilities (sm/md/lg breakpoints). Primarily tested on mobile viewports.

title: Issue list view
description: Read-only issue list page showing all issues in a filterable table. Reuse storage.py to load issues. Support filtering by status, type, priority, and labels via query params. Show columns: ID, title, type, status, priority, labels, updated_at.
acceptance:
- /issues route renders a list of all issues
- Filters for status, type, priority, labels
- Sortable by priority and updated_at
- Links to issue detail view
notes: Mobile-friendly layout: stack filters vertically on small screens, compact table or card-based list on mobile.

title: Kanban board view
description: Read-only kanban board showing issues as cards grouped by status columns (Open, In Progress, In Review, Blocked, Deferred). Each card shows issue ID, title, type badge, and priority indicator. Cards link to issue detail view.
acceptance:
- /kanban route renders a kanban board
- Columns for each active status
- Issue cards with key info
- Cards link to detail view
- Responsive layout with horizontal scroll if needed
notes: Mobile-friendly kanban: consider vertical column stacking or horizontal swipe on small screens.

title: Issue detail view
description: Read-only detail page for a single issue. Shows all fields: title, description, status, priority, type, labels, owner, acceptance criteria, design notes, notes, comments, dependencies (blocks/blocked-by), parent/children, external ref, timestamps. Render markdown in description and notes fields.
acceptance:
- /issues/{issue_id} route renders full issue details
- All issue fields displayed
- Dependencies shown with links to related issues
- Parent/children shown with links
- Comments listed chronologically
- Markdown rendered in text fields
notes: Mobile-friendly detail layout: single-column, readable on small screens.

title: Dependency graph visualization
description: Visual dependency graph showing issue relationships. Consider using a JS graph library (e.g., D3, dagre, mermaid) to render blocks/blocked-by and parent/child relationships.

title: History/timeline view
description: View showing issue change history and timeline. Reuse event log data from storage to show a chronological feed of issue changes across the project.

title: Dashboard/summary stats view
description: Dashboard page with summary statistics: issue counts by status, type, priority. Burn-down style metrics. Overview of project health.

title: Replace Tailwind CDN with standalone CLI build
description: Replace Tailwind CSS CDN link with the standalone Tailwind CLI for offline support and smaller CSS output. Bundle the compiled CSS with the package.

title: File-watching event stream library
description: Internal library that watches issues.jsonl for changes and emits events. Uses watchdog for filesystem monitoring. Exposes a Python API (not CLI) that consumers (web UI, future CLI command) can import. Lives in src/dogcat/stream/ or similar.

title: Read-write support for Web UI
description: Add write capabilities to the Web UI: create issues, update fields, change status, close issues, add comments. Requires CSRF protection and form validation. Reuse storage.py write methods.

title: Multi-project support in Web UI
description: Support loading .dogcats/ folders from multiple repositories simultaneously. Add a project switcher in the nav. Single web server instance serves all configured projects. Configuration for project paths (CLI args or config file).

title: Wire live updates into Web UI via SSE
description: Add SSE endpoint to the web server that uses the internal file-watching stream library (dogcat-3tuf) to push issue change events to the browser. Add JS client-side listener to auto-refresh views without polling. Should import the library directly, not shell out to a CLI command.

title: Web UI test infrastructure and tests
description: Set up test infrastructure for the web UI using httpx AsyncClient as the FastAPI test client. Write tests for all routes: /, /issues, /issues/{id}, /kanban. Test filtering, sorting, error handling (missing issues, invalid filters). Test template rendering produces expected HTML structure. Add to the existing pytest suite.
acceptance:
- Test client fixture using httpx AsyncClient
- Route tests for all endpoints
- Filter and sort parameter tests
- Error case tests (404 for missing issues, bad params)
- Template content assertions
- Integrated into just test

title: Web UI for dogcat
description: Server-side rendered web dashboard for dogcat issue tracking. FastAPI + Jinja2 + Tailwind CSS (CDN). No SPA. Listens on 127.0.0.1 by default. Designed for desktop and mobile, with a mobile-first approach — primarily tested on mobile. Initial version is read-only. Future phases: read-write support, multi-project support, live updates.
acceptance:
- dcat web launches a local web server on 127.0.0.1
- Issue list view with filtering
- Kanban board view
- Issue detail view
- Feature-gated behind DCAT_FEATURE_WEB

Extract shared get_namespaces() utility function
description: Create a shared function (e.g. in storage.py or a utils module) that returns the list of namespaces with counts from storage, skipping tombstones. Currently both 'dcat namespaces' (_cmd_label.py:namespaces_list) and web propose (web/__init__.py:create_app) duplicate this logic by iterating storage.list() and collecting unique namespaces. Consolidate into one reusable function.

Consolidate into one reusable function.

Show current status symbols in dcat diff output
description: Currently dcat diff uses +/~/✓/✗ to indicate what happened (created/updated/closed/deleted), but doesn't reflect the item's current status. Items that are in_review show as + or ~ just like any other item.\n\nChange dcat diff to use status symbols (e.g. ? for in_review, ◐ for in_progress) instead of or in addition to the change-type prefix. This gives at-a-glance meaning when reviewing changes before a commit.

description.new: Currently dcat diff uses +/~/✓/✗ to indicate what happened (created/updated/closed/deleted), but doesn't reflect the item's current status. Items that are in_review show as + or ~ just like any other item.\n\nChange dcat diff to use status symbols (e.g. ? for in_review, ◐ for in_progress) instead of or in addition to the change-type prefix. This gives at-a-glance meaning when reviewing changes before a commit.

title.new: Show current status symbols in dcat diff output

title: Show current status symbols in dcat diff output
Add item counts to status listing headers
description:
Add counts to the section headers in status listing commands so users get a quick overview of how many items are in each category.

Affected commands:
- `dcat pr` (combined view): 'In Progress:' → 'In Progress (3):' and 'In Review (24):'
- `dcat in-progress`: currently no header, could add 'In Progress (n):' or show count in empty message
- `dcat in-review`: same as above
- `dcat ready`: same pattern

The count should reflect the number of issues after filtering (if filters are applied).

title.new: Add item counts to status listing headers

Web propose: refresh after submission shows POST-only error
description: After submitting a proposal via 'dcat web propose', the browser navigates to /propose. Refreshing the page sends a GET to /propose which has no GET handler, resulting in a 'POST only' error. Fix: use Post/Redirect/Get pattern — POST to / and redirect back to / on success.

description.new: After submitting a proposal via 'dcat web propose', the browser navigates to /propose. Refreshing the page sends a GET to /propose which has no GET handler, resulting in a 'POST only' error. Fix: use Post/Redirect/Get pattern — POST to / and redirect back to / on success.

Research: Should inbox.jsonl be merged into issues.jsonl?
description: Investigate whether the separate inbox.jsonl file should be embedded into issues.jsonl instead. If it stays separate, identify any problems with the current approach (e.g. sync issues, merge conflicts, data consistency, tooling gaps).
notes: Decision: Keep inbox.jsonl separate from issues.jsonl. Different data models, different merge strategies, cross-repo safety, and no current problems with the approach. Minor improvement opportunity: document that .issues.lock also protects inbox.jsonl.

notes.new: Decision: Keep inbox.jsonl separate from issues.jsonl. Different data models, different merge strategies, cross-repo safety, and no current problems with the approach. Minor improvement opportunity: document that .issues.lock also protects inbox.jsonl.

title: Research: Should inbox.jsonl be merged into issues.jsonl?
Decide if 'propose' is the right name for the inbox command
description: Evaluate whether 'dcat propose' is the best verb/name for sending cross-repo inbox items. Consider alternatives and how it reads in common usage (e.g. dcat propose vs dcat suggest vs dcat send).
notes: Decision: Keep 'propose' as the command name. Best semantic fit for optional cross-repo suggestions, pairs naturally with inbox, distinct verb with no CLI convention collisions, consistent across CLI and web.

notes.new: Decision: Keep 'propose' as the command name. Best semantic fit for optional cross-repo suggestions, pairs naturally with inbox, distinct verb with no CLI convention collisions, consistent across CLI and web.

title: Decide if 'propose' is the right name for the inbox command

description: Evaluate whether 'dcat propose' is the best verb/name for sending cross-repo inbox items. Consider alternatives and how it reads in common usage (e.g. dcat propose vs dcat suggest vs dcat send).
notes: Decision: Keep 'propose' as the command name. Best semantic fit for optional cross-repo suggestions, pairs naturally with inbox, distinct verb with no CLI convention collisions, consistent across CLI and web.

Implement stale command to show inactive issues
description:
Add a `dcat stale` command that lists issues with no activity (updates, comments, status changes) in a given time period.

## Behavior
- Default threshold: 7 days
- Show issues that have had no activity (no updates, no comments, no status changes) within the threshold

## Options
- `--days N` — filter by N days of inactivity (default: 7)
- `--hours N` — filter by N hours of inactivity
- Also support shorthand duration syntax: `7d`, `7h` (e.g. `dcat stale 7d`, `dcat stale 12h`)
- When both --days and --hours are provided, combine them (e.g. --days 1 --hours 12 = 36 hours)

## Examples
```
dcat stale              # issues with no activity in 7 days
dcat stale --days 14    # issues with no activity in 14 days
dcat stale --hours 48   # issues with no activity in 48 hours
dcat stale 7d           # shorthand for --days 7
dcat stale 3h           # shorthand for --hours 3
```

description.new:
Add a `dcat stale` command that lists issues with no activity (updates, comments, status changes) in a given time period.

## Behavior
- Default threshold: 7 days
- Show issues that have had no activity (no updates, no comments, no status changes) within the threshold

## Options
- `--days N` — filter by N days of inactivity (default: 7)
- `--hours N` — filter by N hours of inactivity
- Also support shorthand duration syntax: `7d`, `7h` (e.g. `dcat stale 7d`, `dcat stale 12h`)
- When both --days and --hours are provided, combine them (e.g. --days 1 --hours 12 = 36 hours)

## Examples
```
dcat stale              # issues with no activity in 7 days
dcat stale --days 14    # issues with no activity in 14 days
dcat stale --hours 48   # issues with no activity in 48 hours
dcat stale 7d           # shorthand for --days 7
dcat stale 3h           # shorthand for --hours 3
```

title.new: Implement stale command to show inactive issues

title: Implement stale command to show inactive issues

Web propose: refresh after submission shows POST-only error
description: After submitting a proposal via 'dcat web propose', the browser navigates to /propose. Refreshing the page sends a GET to /propose which has no GET handler, resulting in a 'POST only' error. Fix: use Post/Redirect/Get pattern — POST to / and redirect back to / on success.

title: Web propose: refresh after submission shows POST-only error
Show current status symbols in dcat diff output
description: Currently dcat diff uses +/~/✓/✗ to indicate what happened (created/updated/closed/deleted), but doesn't reflect the item's current status. Items that are in_review show as + or ~ just like any other item.\n\nChange dcat diff to use status symbols (e.g. ? for in_review, ◐ for in_progress) instead of or in addition to the change-type prefix. This gives at-a-glance meaning when reviewing changes before a commit.

title: Show current status symbols in dcat diff output
Diff shows redundant 'changed -> changed' for long-form fields
description: When a long-form field (description, notes, acceptance, design) is the only change in a diff event, format_event displays 'description: changed -> changed' because both old and new values are replaced with the word 'changed' to avoid dumping full content. This looks confusing and redundant. Should show something like 'description: modified' or 'description: (edited)' instead when both old and new exist.

title.new: Diff shows redundant 'changed -> changed' for long-form fields

description.new: When a long-form field (description, notes, acceptance, design) is the only change in a diff event, format_event displays 'description: changed -> changed' because both old and new values are replaced with the word 'changed' to avoid dumping full content. This looks confusing and redundant. Should show something like 'description: modified' or 'description: (edited)' instead when both old and new exist.

title: Diff shows redundant 'changed -> changed' for long-form fields
Show current status symbols in dcat diff output
description: Currently dcat diff uses +/~/✓/✗ to indicate what happened (created/updated/closed/deleted), but doesn't reflect the item's current status. Items that are in_review show as + or ~ just like any other item.\n\nChange dcat diff to use status symbols (e.g. ? for in_review, ◐ for in_progress) instead of or in addition to the change-type prefix. This gives at-a-glance meaning when reviewing changes before a commit.
close_reason: Implemented status symbols in dcat diff output

title: Show current status symbols in dcat diff output
Web propose: refresh after submission shows POST-only error
description: After submitting a proposal via 'dcat web propose', the browser navigates to /propose. Refreshing the page sends a GET to /propose which has no GET handler, resulting in a 'POST only' error. Fix: use Post/Redirect/Get pattern — POST to / and redirect back to / on success.
close_reason: Fixed: moved POST to / and used PRG pattern with response_model=None

title: Web propose: refresh after submission shows POST-only error
dcat diff should show inbox.jsonl changes
description: dcat diff only compares issues.jsonl against HEAD. It should also show changes to inbox.jsonl (new/closed/deleted proposals).

dcat doctor should validate inbox.jsonl
description: dcat doctor validates issues.jsonl but doesn't check inbox.jsonl at all. Should validate proposal records for malformed data, required fields, etc.

title: Add eslint, stylelint, and djlint for web
dcat export should include inbox
description: dcat export outputs issues/deps/links but no inbox. Should include an inbox section. May also need an export-archived or similar command to export archived proposals.

title.new: dcat export should include inbox

description.old: dcat export outputs issues/deps/links but no proposals. Should include an inbox/proposals section. May also need an export-archived or similar command to export archived proposals.
description.new: dcat export outputs issues/deps/links but no inbox. Should include an inbox section. May also need an export-archived or similar command to export archived proposals.

title: dcat export should include inbox
dcat info should show inbox statuses
description: dcat info lists issue types, statuses, and priorities but doesn't mention inbox statuses (open, closed, tombstone).

title.old: dcat info should show proposal statuses
title.new: dcat info should show inbox statuses

description.old: dcat info lists issue types, statuses, and priorities but doesn't mention proposal statuses (open, closed, tombstone).
description.new: dcat info lists issue types, statuses, and priorities but doesn't mention inbox statuses (open, closed, tombstone).

title: dcat info should show inbox statuses
dcat history should track inbox events
description: Inbox lifecycle events (create, close, delete) are not recorded in the event log. dcat history shows nothing for inbox activity. Note: dcat stream already supports this via InboxStreamEmitter.

title.old: dcat history should track proposal events
title.new: dcat history should track inbox events

description.old: Proposal lifecycle events (create, close, delete) are not recorded in the event log. dcat history shows nothing for inbox activity. Note: dcat stream already supports this via InboxStreamEmitter.
description.new: Inbox lifecycle events (create, close, delete) are not recorded in the event log. dcat history shows nothing for inbox activity. Note: dcat stream already supports this via InboxStreamEmitter.

title: dcat history should track inbox events

Diff shows redundant 'changed -> changed' for long-form fields
description: When a long-form field (description, notes, acceptance, design) is the only change in a diff event, format_event displays 'description: changed -> changed' because both old and new values are replaced with the word 'changed' to avoid dumping full content. This looks confusing and redundant. Should show something like 'description: modified' or 'description: (edited)' instead when both old and new exist.

title: Diff shows redundant 'changed -> changed' for long-form fields
Diff shows redundant 'changed -> changed' for long-form fields
description: When a long-form field (description, notes, acceptance, design) is the only change in a diff event, format_event displays 'description: changed -> changed' because both old and new values are replaced with the word 'changed' to avoid dumping full content. This looks confusing and redundant. Should show something like 'description: modified' or 'description: (edited)' instead when both old and new exist.

title: Diff shows redundant 'changed -> changed' for long-form fields
Add --by flag to inbox delete command
description: inbox close has --by but inbox delete does not. All mutation commands should support --by for attribution.

title: Add --by flag to inbox delete command
dcat prune should handle inbox tombstones
description: dcat prune only removes tombstoned issues from issues.jsonl. Tombstoned proposals in inbox.jsonl are ignored and accumulate indefinitely.

title: dcat prune should handle inbox tombstones
Diff shows redundant 'changed -> changed' for long-form fields
description: When a long-form field (description, notes, acceptance, design) is the only change in a diff event, format_event displays 'description: changed -> changed' because both old and new values are replaced with the word 'changed' to avoid dumping full content. This looks confusing and redundant. Should show something like 'description: modified' or 'description: (edited)' instead when both old and new exist.
close_reason: Fixed: show (edited)/(added)/(removed) instead of changed -> changed for long-form fields

Add item counts to status listing headers
description:
Add counts to the section headers in status listing commands so users get a quick overview of how many items are in each category.

Affected commands:
- `dcat pr` (combined view): 'In Progress:' → 'In Progress (3):' and 'In Review (24):'
- `dcat in-progress`: currently no header, could add 'In Progress (n):' or show count in empty message
- `dcat in-review`: same as above
- `dcat ready`: same pattern

The count should reflect the number of issues after filtering (if filters are applied).

title: Add item counts to status listing headers

title: Add item counts to status listing headers
Hide inbox section from prime output unless --inbox flag is passed
description: The dcat prime command currently always shows the inbox section. It should be hidden by default and only shown when --inbox is explicitly passed.

title: Hide inbox section from prime output unless --inbox flag is passed
Hide inbox section from prime output unless --inbox flag is passed
description: The dcat prime command currently always shows the inbox section. It should be hidden by default and only shown when --inbox is explicitly passed.

title: Hide inbox section from prime output unless --inbox flag is passed
Show inbox items in dcat ready and dcat list --include-inbox
description: Surface inbox items alongside issues in 'dcat ready' (by default or via flag) and add an --include-inbox flag to 'dcat list' so users can see pending proposals without switching to 'dcat inbox list'.

title: Show inbox items in dcat ready and dcat list --include-inbox
Show inbox items in dcat ready and dcat list --include-inbox
description: Surface inbox items alongside issues in 'dcat ready' (by default or via flag) and add an --include-inbox flag to 'dcat list' so users can see pending proposals without switching to 'dcat inbox list'.

title: Show inbox items in dcat ready and dcat list --include-inbox
Add --allow-creating-namespaces / --disable-creating-namespaces to dcat web propose
description: Add runtime flags to 'dcat web propose' (or whatever the command ends up being named) for controlling whether new namespaces can be created during the proposal flow. Also support setting the default in config.toml, but runtime flags should always override the config value.

title: Add --allow-creating-namespaces / --disable-creating-namespaces to dcat web propose
Add --allow-creating-namespaces / --disable-creating-namespaces to dcat web propose

- `dcat in-review`: same as above

dcat namespaces should include namespaces from inbox proposals
description: When a proposal is submitted via the web UI with a new namespace (e.g. 'katt'), it appears in inbox.jsonl but dcat namespaces only reads from issues.jsonl. The new namespace doesn't show up in the namespaces list until an issue is actually created in that namespace. The namespaces command should also count inbox proposals so new namespaces are visible immediately.

description.new: When a proposal is submitted via the web UI with a new namespace (e.g. 'katt'), it appears in inbox.jsonl but dcat namespaces only reads from issues.jsonl. The new namespace doesn't show up in the namespaces list until an issue is actually created in that namespace. The namespaces command should also count inbox proposals so new namespaces are visible immediately.

title.new: dcat namespaces should include namespaces from inbox proposals

title: dcat namespaces should include namespaces from inbox proposals
